chapter.title: Cash Management
chapter.para:
The Cash Management functions allow the user to view existing loans and to request and manage Fixed Deposit placements with the Bank . It provides the following two functions.
Loan Inquiry
Display a summary list of current loans.
Fixed Deposit
create and list Fixed Deposit loans.

section.para: The Loan Inquiry function allows the user to display a summary of current loans with the Bank. In initial screen requests details to be used for the loan search. the details used are:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
The name of the Company the loans belong to.
Enter the Entity associated with the Loan. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid Entities.
Enter the account number associated with the Loan. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid accounts.

section.para: There is also a field where you can select an Output Format for the results:

listitem.para: Screen (default) returns the list of matching records on the same page with the usual sorting features.
CSV downloads the report to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the report to your machine as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: You would typically use the CSV or SpreadSheet option if you want to export the list as a report to use it or customize it further in your office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, you can choose to save the file (whose default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it which will launch Excel if it is available on your workstation.
The list is not produced until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To list all loans for the company, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

The module is used to initiate the FD transaction and provide maturity/interest payment and withdrawal instructions. The bank and customer can also make inquiry on the FD transaction which has been created in the .

section.title: Fixed Deposit Terminology
section.para: Within this chapter of the help guide, the terms "FD", "Fixed Deposit" and "Term Deposit" are used interchangeably. The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: FD Placement
section.para: This section describes the FD Placement part of the menu and the forms it uses.

section.title: FD Placement Option
section.para:
This part of the menu contains several options, providing methods to create a Fixed Deposit placement and view existing unapproved FD placements.
From Scratch
Enter the details of a new FD Placement and submit them to the Bank.
Retrieve Draft
Review, complete and submit records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Retrieve Unsigned
Review and submit records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: FD Placement - Retrieve Draft
section.para: This option allows FD Placement records that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of FD Placement records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: FD Placement - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows the completion of FD Placement records that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit.

When selected, this option will present a list of FD Placement records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the message in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: FD Withdrawal - From Existing FDs

The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Bank Reference or Currency field.
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

section.title: FD Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain Fixed Deposit records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: FD Maintenance - Unsigned FDs
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) Fixed Deposit transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: FD Maintenance - Purged Maintain
section.para: List and optionally delete Fixed Deposit transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: FD Maintenance - Rejected FDs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of Fixed Deposit records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
